```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE, comment = NA,
                      options(digits = 3, scipen = 999))
library(tidyverse)
library(plm)
library(stargazer)
df <- # data
  here::here("data", "covid_data_final.csv") %>% 
  read_csv() %>% 
  filter(date >= "2020-03-01")

sc_names <-
  df %>%
  names() 

soc_cap_measures <- sc_names[c(14:17, 46:53)]
```



# Table 2

```{r table-2, results='asis', eval=FALSE}
stargazer(
  df %>%
    plm(
      cases_new ~ stringency_index_lag * state_level_index +
        I(stringency_index_lag ^ 2),
      data = .,
      effect = "time",
      index = "state",
      model = "within"
    ),
  df %>%
    plm(
      cases_new ~ stringency_index_lag * state_level_index +
        I(stringency_index_lag ^ 2),
      data = .,
      effect = "twoways",
      index = "state",
      method = "within"
    ),
  df %>%
    plm(
      cases_new ~ stringency_index_lag * state_level_index +
        I(stringency_index_lag ^ 2) +
        median_household_income +
        percent_adults_with_ba +
        percent_in_fair_or_poor_health +
        percent_black +
        density +
        percent_rural +
        percent_65 +
        average_temperature +
        governor_political_affiliation,
      data = .,
      effect = "time",
      index = "state",
      model = "within"
    ),
  df %>%
    plm(
      cases_new ~ stringency_index_lag * state_level_index  +
        I(stringency_index_lag ^ 2) +
        average_temperature +
        governor_political_affiliation +
        percent_in_fair_or_poor_health |
        median_household_income +
        percent_adults_with_ba +
        percent_black +
        density +
        percent_rural +
        percent_65 +
        average_temperature +
        governor_political_affiliation +
        percent_in_fair_or_poor_health +
        stringency_index_lag +
        I(stringency_index_lag) ^ 2,
      data = .,
      effect = "time",
      index = "state",
      model = "within"
    ),
  type = "latex",
  df = FALSE,
  covariate.labels = c(
    "$\\mathrm{Stringency_{t-7}}$",
    "Social K",
    "$\\mathrm{Stringency}_{t-7}^2$",
    "Median Income",
    "\\% Bachelor's",
    "\\% Fair/Poor Health",
    "\\% Black",
    "Population Density",
    "\\% Rural",
    "\\% > 65",
    "Average Temperature",
    "Republican Governor",
    "$\\mathrm{Stringency_{t-7}}$ * Social K"
  ),
  title = "Fixed Effects Regression Results",
  dep.var.labels = "Daily New Cases per Million",
  column.labels = c("$\\mathrm{FE_{i,t}}$", "$\\mathrm{FE_t}$", "$\\mathrm{FE_t}$", "$\\mathrm{IVFE_t}$"),
  header = FALSE
)
```

# Table 4

```{r table-4, results='asis', eval=FALSE}
table_3_models <- list()

for (i in 1:4) {
  # for(i in 1:1)  {
  # sc_i <- soc_cap_measures[i]
  
  table_3_models[[i]] <-
    df %>%
    plm(
      cases_new ~ stringency_index_lag * get(soc_cap_measures[i]) +
        I(stringency_index_lag ^ 2),
      data = .,
      effect = "twoways",
      index = "state",
      model = "within"
    ) 
}

names(table_3_models) <- soc_cap_measures[1:4]


stargazer(
  table_3_models,
  type = "latex",
  model.names = FALSE,
  df = FALSE,
  covariate.labels = c(
    "$\\mathrm{Stringency_{t-7}}$",
    "$\\mathrm{Stringency}_{t-7}^2$",
    "$\\mathrm{Stringency_{t-7}}$ * Social K"
  ),
  title = "Alternative Measures of Social Capital Regression Results",
  dep.var.labels = "Daily New Cases per Million",
  header = FALSE,
  column.labels = c(
    "Penn State",
    "Putnam",
    "Alesina La Ferrara",
    "Family Prosperity"
  )
)
```



```{r des-stats}
df %>%
  select(
    cases_new,
    stringency_index,
    median_household_income,
    percent_adults_with_ba,
    percent_in_fair_or_poor_health,
    percent_black,
    density,
    percent_rural,
    percent_65,
    average_temperature,
    state_level_index
  ) %>%
  pastecs::stat.desc() %>%
  rownames_to_column("stat") %>%
  filter(stat %in% c("nbr.val",
                     "min",
                     "max",
                     "mean",
                     "median",
                     "std.dev")) %>%
  pivot_longer(-stat) %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = "stat") %>%
  select(-name) %>% 
  mutate(row_names = c("New Cases", 
                       "Stringency Index",
                       "Median Household Income",
                       "% Adults w/ Bachelor's",
                       "% Fair or Poor Health",
                       "% Black",
                       "Pop. Density",
                       "% Rural",
                       "% > 65",
                       "Average Temperature",
                       "Social Capital Index")) %>% 
  gt(rowname_col = "row_names") %>%
  tab_header(title = "Descriptive Statistics") %>%
  cols_label(
    nbr.val = "N",
    min = "Min",
    max = "Max",
    median = "Median",
    mean = "Mean",
    std.dev = glue::glue("Standard \n Deviation")
  ) %>%
  cols_align("center") %>% 
  fmt_number(columns = c("mean","median"),
             decimals = 2) %>% 
  gt::as_latex()
```
